Draft resolution submitted by the Chair of the Committee following 
informal consultations 
 
 
Financing of the United Nations Support Office in Haiti 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Having considered the note by the Secretary-General on the financing 
arrangements for the United Nations Support Office in Haiti1 and the related report 
of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions,2 
 
Recalling Security Council resolution 2793 (2025) of 30 September 2025, in 
which the Council requested that the Secretary-General establish the United Nations 
Support Office in Haiti to provide support, primarily to the Gang Suppression Force, 
the United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti, the Haitian National Police and the 
Haitian Armed Forces on any joint operations with the Gang Suppression Force, as 
well as technical support to the Organization of American States, in accordance with 
the funding modalities set out therein, with a view to assuming full logistical support 
responsibility for the Gang Suppression Force within six months of adoption, 
 
1. 
Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of 
the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions, and requests 
the Secretary-General to ensure their full implementation; 
 
Estimates for the period from 1 October 2025 to 30 June 2026 
 
 
2. 
Authorizes the Secretary-General to establish a special account for the 
United Nations Support Office in Haiti for the purpose of accounting for the income 
received and the expenditure incurred in respect of the Office; 
 
3. 
Also authorizes the Secretary-General to enter into commitments for the 
Office in an amount not exceeding 271,328,700 United States dollars for the period 
from 1 October 2025 to 30 June 2026, inclusive of the amounts of 54,163,500 dollars 
and of 50,000,000 dollars of the available balance of the stores available from the

Organization’s strategic deployment stocks, previously authorized by the Advisory 
Committee for the period from 1 October to 31 December 2025 under the terms of 
section VI of General Assembly resolution 64/269 of 24 June 2010; 
 
Financing of the commitment authority 
 
 
4. 
Decides to apportion among Member States the amount of 271,328,700 
dollars for the period from 1 October 2025 to 30 June 2026, in accordance with the 
levels updated in its resolution 79/250 of 24 December 2024, taking into account the 
scale of assessments for 2025 and 2026, as set out in its resolution 79/249 of 
24 December 2024; 
 
5. 
Also decides that, in accordance with the provisions of its resolution 973 (X) 
of 15 December 1955, there shall be set off against the apportionment among Member 
States, as provided for in paragraph 4 above, their respective share in the Tax 
Equalization Fund of 1,792,900 dollars, representing the estimated staff assessment 
income approved for the Office for the period from 1 October 2025 to 30 June 2026; 
 
6. 
Invites voluntary contributions to the United Nations trust fund established 
to support the Gang Suppression Force.
